DOC.brief_summary: The main objective study demonstrate superiority non-inferiority sirolimus-eluting Bx VELOCITYÂ® stent compare intravascular brachytherapy patient in-stent restenotic native coronary artery lesion .
DOC.brief_title: Sirolimus-Eluting Stent vs. Intravascular Brachytherapy In-Stent Restenotic Coronary Artery Lesions ( SISR )
DOC.criteria: 1 . The patient instent restenosis > 50 % ( subjective angiographic determination minimal luminal diameter compare distal reference diameter ) within native coronary artery previously undergone stent placement ( 4 week ) . Lesions must meet ISR Classification IIII . 2 . The patient history , sign , laboratory study suggest coronary ischemia attributable target stenosis . The diagnosis angina pectoris define Canadian Cardiovascular Society Classification ( CCS I , II , III , IV ) OR unstable angina pectoris ( Braunwald Classification B & C , III ) OR patient document silent ischemia ; 3 . The study target lesion must locate instent restenotic native coronary artery measure > 2.75mm 3.5mm diameter > 15mm 40mm length allow treatment maximum three 18mm stent . The target lesion must undergo coronary interventional treatment > 4 week previously . Patients one prior percutaneous coronary intervention target lesion acceptable candidate . 4 . The vessel 1cm distal target lesion > 2.5mm diameter ; 5 . Ejection Fraction must > 40 % ; 6 . The study target lesion locate vessel contain second lesion require treatment time procedure . 7 . Male nonpregnant female patient > 18 year age inclusive . NOTE : Females childbearing potential must negative pregnancy test ( urine serum ) prior enrollment must use birth control 6 month . 1 . The study target lesion definite possible thrombus present angiographic criterion . 2 . The patient experience Qwave nonQwave myocardial infarction document total CK > 2 time normal within precede 24 hour CK CKMB enzymes remain normal time treatment . 3 . Impaired renal function ( Serum creatinine > 2.0mg/dl ) ; 4 . The patient unstable angina classify Braunwald III B C , peri infarction angina . 5 . The left ventricular ejection fraction < 40 % . 6 . The target vessel previously sustain perforation . 7 . Totally occluded vessel ( TIMI 0 level ) ; 8 . Prior stent within 5mm target lesion ; 9 . There total occlusion restenosedstent ( ISR Classification IV ) prior interventional procedure . 10 . Has ostial target lesion ; 11 .
